page.title: 09Life In The 'Eighties.
page.content: Life in the nineteen_eighties is based more and more around sophisticated and modern appliances.Video recorders are used to record television programmes for our convenience,while the televisions themselves can be remotely controlled.Modern televisions are also equipped with teletext capability and a new televisual breakthrough;cable television. Other advances include washing machines and tumble dryers which are computer controlled,solar heated swimming pools and houses,micro wave ovens which can cook frozen foods in mere minutes,a worldwide telephone network which enables you to call the other side of the world on a handheld, compact set and fast acting,computer controlled bank service tills which allow sums of money to be deposited or withdrawn in seconds.
